function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Lack of empirical evidence on the effects of urban design on COVID-19 spread","Impact":"Ineffective response measures and increased risk of disease spread","Mitigation":"Conduct research studies to gather empirical evidence on the relationship between urban design and disease spread","Technologies":"Epidemiological modeling, data collection and analysis tools","People":"Cities, urban planners, public health officials","Owner":"Research organizations, public health agencies"},{"Description":"Debate on the link between COVID-19 prevalence and urban design characteristics","Impact":"Uncertainty in decision-making and planning for urban development","Mitigation":"Promote interdisciplinary research to understand the relationship between urban design and disease spread","Technologies":"Data analytics, simulation modeling, interdisciplinary collaboration platforms","People":"City planners, researchers, public health experts","Owner":"Research institutions, urban planning organizations"},{"Description":"Advocacy for compact urban development without clear evidence on its impact on disease spread","Impact":"Potential reliance on an ineffective strategy for disease mitigation","Mitigation":"Perform comprehensive analysis to understand the impacts of compact urban development on disease spread","Technologies":"Geospatial analysis, epidemiological modeling, scenario planning tools","People":"Urban planners, policy makers, public health officials","Owner":"Public health agencies, urban planning organizations"}]}
